ext_description.p: An Add_design_object_management_relationship is a type of .
ext_description.note: Together with and , Add_design_object_management_relationship supports the exchange of changes to a design by the use of a data set containing only (1) the information necessary to identify the design, such as, an or an , which is assumed to be already known to the receiving system, and (2) the design objects that have been added, changed, or deleted. All the quality and structural requirements defined in this part of ISO 10303 may also apply to the resultant new design iteration.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: specifies the role of the for the Add_design_object_management_relationship.
the words by which the Add_design_object_management_relationship is known. It specifies the value 'add' for the Add_design_object_management_relationship.
The current_design_object shall be unique within a population of Add_design_object_management_relationship.

A Change_design_object_management_relationship is a type of . A Change_design_object_management_relationship may be a , or a , or a . The Change_design_object_management_relationship provides information about the relationship between a design object before and after a design change.
specifies a from which the current design was derived. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
specifies a which resulted from a design change.
specifies a string value for the Change_design_object_management_relationship. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the words by which the Change_design_object_management_relationship is known.
The combination of the current_design_object shall be unique within a population of Change_design_object_management_relationship.
The combination of previous_design_object shall be unique within a population of Change_design_object_management_relationship.

ext_description.p: type of current_design_object shall be the same type as previous_design_object.
current_design_object should not be equal to previous_design_object.

A Delete_design_object_management_relationship is a type of . Together with and , Delete_design_object_management_relationship supports the exchange of changes to a design by the use of a data set containing only (1) the information necessary to identify the design (e.g., an or an ), which is assumed to be already known to the receiving system, and (2) the design objects that have been added, changed, or deleted.
ext_description.note: Note that all the quality and structural requirements defined in this part of ISO 10303 also apply to the resultant new design iteration.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: specifies the role of the for the Delete_design_object_management_relationship.

ext_description.p: the words by which the Delete_design_object_management_relationship is known.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: The combination of the previous_design_object inherited from shall be unique within a population of Delete_design_object_management_relationships.

A Design_object_management_relationship is a type of . A Design_object_management_relationship is one of an , a , or a . A Design_object_management_relationship specifies the relationship between the original design and a design change via the .
the words by which the Design_object_management_relationship is known.
A View_dependent_design_object_management_relationship is a type of an .
specifies the current , after the change, for the .
specifies the , before the change, for the .
the words by which the View_dependent_design_object_management_relationship is known.
A Design_object_management_relationship_assignment is a mean to relate with .
specifies the for the Design_object_management_relationship_assignment.
specifies the , for the Design_object_management_relationship_assignment.
A Frozen_assignment is the specification that one or more must be unchanged during further design activity.
specifies a for which the design is to remain unchanged in the Frozen_assignment. There shall be one or more for a Frozen_assignment.
